pageProps.contentHtml:
Young's inequality

Let φ ⁣:R→R\func{\phi}{\R}{\R}φ:R→R be a continuous function with compact support.

  1. Prove that there is a constant AAA such that

    ∥f∗φ∥Lq≤A∥f∥Lpfor all1≤p≤q≤∞and allf∈Lp.\norm{f * \phi}_{L^q} \leq A\norm{f}_{L^p} \quad\text{for all}\quad 1 \leq p \leq q \leq \infty \quad\text{and all}\quad f \in L^p.∥f∗φ∥Lq​≤A∥f∥Lp​for all1≤p≤q≤∞and allf∈Lp.

    If you use Young's (convolution) inequality, you should prove it.

  2. Show by example that such a general inequality cannot hold for p>qp > qp>q.
Solution.

  1. We will first prove Young's convolution inequality: if 1p+1q=1r+1\frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{q} = \frac{1}{r} + 1p1​+q1​=r1​+1, f∈Lp(R)f \in L^p\p{\R}f∈Lp(R), g∈Lq(R)g \in L^q\p{\R}g∈Lq(R), then ∥f∗g∥Lr≤∥f∥Lp∥g∥Lq\norm{f * g}_{L^r} \leq \norm{f}_{L^p} \norm{g}_{L^q}∥f∗g∥Lr​≤∥f∥Lp​∥g∥Lq​.

    Notice that because 1≤p,q≤∞1 \leq p, q \leq \infty1≤p,q≤∞, we have 1p,1q≥1\frac{1}{p}, \frac{1}{q} \geq 1p1​,q1​≥1, and so 1p,1q≥1r\frac{1}{p}, \frac{1}{q} \geq \frac{1}{r}p1​,q1​≥r1​ from the condition on p,q,rp, q, rp,q,r. Thus,

    1=1p+1q−1r=(1p−1r)+(1q−1r)+1r=r−ppr+r−qqr+1r.\begin{aligned} 1 &= \frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{q} - \frac{1}{r} \\ &= \p{\frac{1}{p} - \frac{1}{r}} + \p{\frac{1}{q} - \frac{1}{r}} + \frac{1}{r} \\ &= \frac{r - p}{pr} + \frac{r - q}{qr} + \frac{1}{r}. \end{aligned}1​=p1​+q1​−r1​=(p1​−r1​)+(q1​−r1​)+r1​=prr−p​+qrr−q​+r1​.​

    Since all the terms are non-negative and sum to 111, we see that r−ppr,r−qpqr∈[0,1]\frac{r-p}{pr}, \frac{r-q}{pqr} \in \br{0, 1}prr−p​,pqrr−q​∈[0,1], so if we set 1p′=r−ppr\frac{1}{p'} = \frac{r-p}{pr}p′1​=prr−p​ and 1q′=r−qqr\frac{1}{q'} = \frac{r-q}{qr}q′1​=qrr−q​, then 1p′+1q′+1r=1\frac{1}{p'} + \frac{1}{q'} + \frac{1}{r} = 1p′1​+q′1​+r1​=1. We have

    1−pp′=1−r−pr=pr1−qq′=1−r−qr=qr.\begin{gathered} 1 - \frac{p}{p'} = 1 - \frac{r - p}{r} = \frac{p}{r} \\ 1 - \frac{q}{q'} = 1 - \frac{r - q}{r} = \frac{q}{r}. \end{gathered}1−p′p​=1−rr−p​=rp​1−q′q​=1−rr−q​=rq​.​

    Thus, by Hölder's inequality,

    ∣(f∗φ)(x)∣≤∫R∣f(x−y)φ(y)∣ dy=∫R∣f(x−y)∣p/p′∣f(x−y)∣1−p/p′∣φ(y)∣q/q′∣φ(y)∣1−q/q′ dy=∫R∣f(x−y)∣p/p′∣φ(y)∣q/q′(∣f(x−y)∣p/r∣φ(y)∣q/r) dy≤(∫R∣f(x−y)∣p dy)1/p′(∫R∣φ(y)∣q dy)1/q′(∫R∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣q dy)1/r=∥f∥Lpp/p′∥φ∥Lqq/q′(∫R∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣q dy)1/r.\begin{aligned} \abs{\p{f * \phi}\p{x}} &\leq \int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}\phi\p{y}} \,\diff{y} \\ &= \int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^{p/p'} \abs{f\p{x - y}}^{1-p/p'} \abs{\phi\p{y}}^{q/q'} \abs{\phi\p{y}}^{1-q/q'} \,\diff{y} \\ &= \int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^{p/p'} \abs{\phi\p{y}}^{q/q'} \p{\abs{f\p{x - y}}^{p/r} \abs{\phi\p{y}}^{q/r}} \,\diff{y} \\ &\leq \p{\int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^p \,\diff{y}}^{1/p'} \p{\int_\R \abs{\phi\p{y}}^q \,\diff{y}}^{1/q'} \p{\int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^p \abs{\phi\p{y}}^q \,\diff{y}}^{1/r} \\ &= \norm{f}_{L^p}^{p/p'} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^{q/q'} \p{\int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^p \abs{\phi\p{y}}^q \,\diff{y}}^{1/r}. \end{aligned}∣(f∗φ)(x)∣​≤∫R​∣f(x−y)φ(y)∣dy=∫R​∣f(x−y)∣p/p′∣f(x−y)∣1−p/p′∣φ(y)∣q/q′∣φ(y)∣1−q/q′dy=∫R​∣f(x−y)∣p/p′∣φ(y)∣q/q′(∣f(x−y)∣p/r∣φ(y)∣q/r)dy≤(∫R​∣f(x−y)∣pdy)1/p′(∫R​∣φ(y)∣qdy)1/q′(∫R​∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣qdy)1/r=∥f∥Lpp/p′​∥φ∥Lqq/q′​(∫R​∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣qdy)1/r.​

    Continuing,

    ∥f∗φ∥Lrr≤∫R∥f∥Lppr/p′∥φ∥Lqqr/q′∫R∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣q dy dx=∥f∥Lpr−p∥φ∥Lqr−q∫R∣φ(y)∣q∫R∣f(x−y)∣p dx dy(by Fubini-Tonelli)=∥f∥Lpr−p∥φ∥Lqr−q∥φ∥Lqq∥f∥Lpp=∥f∥Lpr∥φ∥Lqr  ⟹  ∥f∗φ∥Lr≤∥f∥Lp∥φ∥Lq.\begin{aligned} \norm{f * \phi}_{L^r}^r &\leq \int_\R \norm{f}_{L^p}^{pr/p'} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^{qr/q'} \int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^p \abs{\phi\p{y}}^q \,\diff{y} \,\diff{x} \\ &= \norm{f}_{L^p}^{r-p} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^{r-q} \int_\R \abs{\phi\p{y}}^q \int_\R \abs{f\p{x - y}}^p \,\diff{x} \,\diff{y} && (\text{by Fubini-Tonelli}) \\ &= \norm{f}_{L^p}^{r-p} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^{r-q} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^q \norm{f}_{L^p}^p \\ &= \norm{f}_{L^p}^r \norm{\phi}_{L^q}^r \\ \implies \norm{f * \phi}_{L^r} &\leq \norm{f}_{L^p} \norm{\phi}_{L^q}. \end{aligned}∥f∗φ∥Lrr​⟹∥f∗φ∥Lr​​≤∫R​∥f∥Lppr/p′​∥φ∥Lqqr/q′​∫R​∣f(x−y)∣p∣φ(y)∣qdydx=∥f∥Lpr−p​∥φ∥Lqr−q​∫R​∣φ(y)∣q∫R​∣f(x−y)∣pdxdy=∥f∥Lpr−p​∥φ∥Lqr−q​∥φ∥Lqq​∥f∥Lpp​=∥f∥Lpr​∥φ∥Lqr​≤∥f∥Lp​∥φ∥Lq​.​​(by Fubini-Tonelli)​

    To prove the inequality, observe that

    1−1p+1q≥1  ⟹  ∃r∈[1,∞] such that 1−1p+1q=1r  ⟹  1p+1r=1q+1.1 - \frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{q} \geq 1 \implies \exists r \in \br{1, \infty} \text{ such that } 1 - \frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{q} = \frac{1}{r} \implies \frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{r} = \frac{1}{q} + 1.1−p1​+q1​≥1⟹∃r∈[1,∞] such that 1−p1​+q1​=r1​⟹p1​+r1​=q1​+1.

    Thus, because φ\phiφ has compact support, φ∈Lr(R)\phi \in L^r\p{\R}φ∈Lr(R), so Young's convolution inequality gives

    ∥f∗φ∥Lq≤∥φ∥Lr∥f∥Lp.\norm{f * \phi}_{L^q} \leq \norm{\phi}_{L^r}\norm{f}_{L^p}.∥f∗φ∥Lq​≤∥φ∥Lr​∥f∥Lp​.

    Hence, A=∥φ∥LrA = \norm{\phi}_{L^r}A=∥φ∥Lr​ works, which completes the proof.

  2. Let φ ⁣:R→R\func{\phi}{\R}{\R}φ:R→R be defined as follows: φ(x)=0\phi\p{x} = 0φ(x)=0 for x∉[1,2]x \notin \br{1, 2}x∈/[1,2], φ(x)=1\phi\p{x} = 1φ(x)=1 for x∈[0,1]x \in \br{0, 1}x∈[0,1], and linear on [−1,0]\br{-1, 0}[−1,0] and [1,2]\br{1, 2}[1,2].

    Since p>qp > qp>q, there exists α>0\alpha > 0α>0 such that q<1α<pq < \frac{1}{\alpha} < pq<α1​<p, and set f(x)=1xαf\p{x} = \frac{1}{x^\alpha}f(x)=xα1​ on [1,∞)\pco{1, \infty}[1,∞) and 000 otherwise. Observe that qα<1<pαq\alpha < 1 < p\alphaqα<1<pα, so f∈Lp(R)f \in L^p\p{\R}f∈Lp(R), but f∉Lq(R)f \notin L^q\p{\R}f∈/Lq(R). Notice that for x≥1x \geq 1x≥1,

    (f∗φ)(x)=∫Rf(x−y)φ(y) dy≥∫01f(x−y) dy=∫x−1x1yα dy≥1xα,\begin{aligned} \p{f * \phi}\p{x} &= \int_\R f\p{x - y}\phi\p{y} \,\diff{y} \\ &\geq \int_0^1 f\p{x - y} \,\diff{y} \\ &= \int_{x-1}^x \frac{1}{y^\alpha} \,\diff{y} \\ &\geq \frac{1}{x^\alpha}, \end{aligned}(f∗φ)(x)​=∫R​f(x−y)φ(y)dy≥∫01​f(x−y)dy=∫x−1x​yα1​dy≥xα1​,​

    where the last inequality comes from the fact that fff is a decreasing function. Thus, f∗φ∉Lq(R)f * \phi \notin L^q\p{\R}f∗φ∈/Lq(R), so the inequality cannot hold.
